p: Pomegranates ( Punica granatum L.) are consumed as fresh fruits and processed into products such as jam, juice, jelly, wine, and dried snacks [ 1]. In addition to increased production volumes, the inconvenience associated with fresh pomegranate consumption due to the fruit complexity has promoted the fruit’s processing into these ready to eat and convenient products [ 2]. Moreover, the consumption of the fruit is related to its medicinal properties. The fruit’s pharmacological value can be traced back to ancient times when the fruit was used as a traditional medicine to treat different ailments [ 3].
